did.langmaterial: The material is in English and Polish
did.abstract: Collector of materials documenting Michigan Polish-American individuals and organizations, especially in Detroit and Hamtramck. Included are records of the Detroit Board of Water Commissioners, the Polish Army Veterans Association, and the Polish Sea League. The collection also contains photographs from various Polish photography studios in Detroit and Michigan, including portraits and topical photographs.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: Materials were received from Dr. Edward Martin (donor no. 9820) in 2006-2009.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Edward Martin collection, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Dr. Edward Martin, a Detroit and Flint, Michigan physician, is a collector of materials largely documenting the activities of Polish American individuals and organizations in the Detroit area.

scopecontent.p: The Edward Martin collection consists of papers and photographs, accumulated from various sources, relate to Detroit organizations and individuals. Except for a small series of Detroit Board of Water Commissioners documents, the collection concerns Michigan's Polish-American community and the activities of Polish-American organization, including the Polish Army Veterans Association and the Polish Sea League. Much of the collection consists of photographic portraits from studios catering to the Polish-American community in Detroit and Hamtramck.

The collection consists of seven series: Detroit Board of Water Commissioners, Polish Army Veterans Association, Polish Sea League, Printed Polish Materials, Waclaw S. Jakubowski papers, Miscellaneous, and Photographs.

scopecontent.p: The Detroit Board of Water Commissioners series (0.4 linear feet, 1852-1963) primarily contains business correspondence (mostly incoming) of the Detroit Board of Water Commissioners. Photographs of offices and staff as well as pipes, machinery and workers can also be found in this series.

did.unittitle: Polish Army Veterans' Association of America 1946-1984

scopecontent.p: The Polish Army Veterans' Association series (1.5 linear foot, 1946-1984) includes minutes, correspondence, financial records, membership lists, convention materials, and a photograph primarily documenting the Association's District no. 6 in Detroit.

did.unittitle: Protocols, membership records, financial materials, photographs, etc.
Polish Sea League of America (Liga Morska) 1936-1983

scopecontent.p: The Polish Sea League series (0.25 linear feet, 1936-1983) contains minutes, financial records, and other miscellaneous administrative material primarily relating to the Flint, Michigan Chapter of the Polish Sea League.

The Printed Polish Materials series (0.25 linear feet, 1932-2004) consists of programs, invitations, newsletters, advertisements and other printed material relating to Polish organizations and activities, both locally (in Detroit, Hamtramck, and Wyandotte) and nationally.

odd.p: (includes Polish American calendar, Polish dance album (music), handbook for citizenship and clipping)

scopecontent.p: The Waclaw S. Jakubowski papers (1 linear foot and 1 oversize volume) consists of collected material, mainly clippings, relating to the "Poletown" area of Detroit and to his activities with the Konrad Club (named for the writer Joseph Conrad. The clippings date from the 1930s and are from Polish language newspapers.

did.unittitle: Clippings and other materials relating to the "Poletown" community in Detroit 1930s
Scrapbook of clippings regarding in part the Konrad Club (of which Jakubowski was president)

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous (5.5 linear feet and 2 oversize volumes) series includes scrapbooks, photograph albums, letters, and other materials. One scrapbook includes photographs, programs, and correspondence of the American Legion Christian Post no. 278 in Detroit. Two of the albums contain photographs, programs, and other materials of Post 1452, Veterans of Foreign Wars, Clio, Michigan. In addition, there is a scrapbook containing clippings of advertisements from 1945 to 1947 of the Cunningham's Drug Store, a chain of drug stores that operated principally in Detroit and Southeastern Michigan.

did.unittitle: Photograph albums / Scrapbooks of Post 1452 Veterans of Foreign Wars, Clio, Michigan
Collected Polonia, drawn from different sources
Photograph album with some invitations of Viola Owings (Detroit African American resident) and her family, 1942-1943
American Legion. Christian Post no. 278 (Detroit, Mich.) circa 1948-1965

odd.p: (include full-page advertisements used in various Michigan newspapers)

did.unittitle: Polish-American marriage certificates, professional registration certificates, diplomas, etc.
Political, commercial, and special event posters
Ship's logs: Peace II, Logs 1970-1971 seasons

scopecontent.p: The Photographs (6 linear feet in 13 boxes, ca. 1880s-1970s and undated) are from Polish photography studios (mainly in Detroit), Michigan. They consist primarily of wedding portraits and confirmation photographs. Also included is a photograph album of Nicholas Lubinski of Detroit, Michigan. This album includes family photographs, largely undated, of weddings, vacations, and special occasions, ca. 1920-1950s. There are also a few topical photographs of businesses, leisure time activities, African American life, etc.

did.unittitle: Polish photography studios and other Michigan studios (Detroit, Michigan unless indicated otherwise)

odd.p: (include barber shop and men's clothing store, ca. 1920s)
